number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have played this game coutless hours since alpha was released in 2013.This game had mod support from day 1. If you know your way around a 3D Program and learn how to implement your models into the in game engine, you can make pretty much anything you want.Some of the most innovative vehicles for this game came from the community, which is a cool thing in my opinion.The game is still in development and the potential of it is almost unfathomable. I expect more great things to come from the devs and the community.There is something relaxing about smashing cars into walls... but this game is about more than just crashing. I truly enjoy just driving around and with the race update coming soon (I hope multiplayer eventually) There is no doubt that this game will be huge.10/10 Best vehicle physics on the market.Next Car Game: go suck a donger.EDIT: Updated 2016 - This game continues to improve and the devs show no sign of stopping. This is one epicly unique game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game may not be what you are expecting, especially as of now.The game is meant to be a simulator, and all "game" aspects are secondary to that.That is not to say that it isn't fun, but it might not be to your liking.Being more of a simulator than a game, that also means the driving mechanics may be nothing like what you expect.Ideally you would play with a wheel instead of a gamepad, and would treat the cars much like you'd treat a real one.I wasn't going to review the game until it got to the Race Update at least, but I don't think I'll change my opinions. I've owned this since Christmas '13 and it's mid-August. Development has been pretty consistent and I've seen it grow quite a bit in this short time. The community is still getting off the ground, but the move to Steam should help greatly. I've had quite a lot of fun with this prior to its release on Steam, and I am sure I will in the future.While I will recommend the game, I will do so with the warning that it really isn't for everyone.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								I've had this game for a good 1-2 years before they added it on steam and i love it. If you are the kind of person that LOVES crashing cars, then GET THIS GAME. The physics are unreal. They are incredible. Pros:- Incredibly realistic phsyics- Great graphics for a physics based game- Greats mods (maps, vehicles, engines, etc)- make your own custom maps- vehicles are great- TONS of options for your cars (not quite total customization, but you can change the colors, engines, type of car [i.e. make a care the "off-road" version of that car and much more], etc.) - shadows are great- modding this game without the steam workshop is very easy- it is in alpha state, and yet i have not had much trouble with any bugs. Maybe a few here and there but it's in good state right now- there are 5 motion options: Realtime, 2x slower than realtime, 4x slower than realtime, 8x slower than realtime, and 100x slower than realtime- car crashes are unbelievably realistic and awesomeCons:- You will need at least a decent computer to be able to play this game- shadows (at highest setting) take A LOT of memory and can cause, depending on your kind of computer, a 5-50 fps drop (since my machine isnt the greatest, i lose a great amount of FPS if i put shadows on high. I lose about 30-40 FPS)- i personally did not enjoy the default maps that came with the game. BUT there are AMAZING custom maps on the forums that you can download (mods)Final verdict: If you like crashing cars, get this game. If you love realistic physics in videogames, get this game. If you are looking for a racing game, this game might not be for you. YES this game IS getting a racing update, but i doubt it will be as good as other games that are made specifically for racing (forza, burnout, need for speed, etc.). But i hope the team at BeamNG proves me wrong on that statement :D

content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								I am very picky when it comes to driving/racing games. I like the feel of the cars to be realistic, which is exactly what BeamNG.drive gives me. The cars not only drive well, but the default terrains look spectacular, and the modding community is rapidly growing. None of this, however, compares to the stunning physics this game provides. BeamNG.drive allows me to see what would happen if I crashed a 1980s sports car into a tree, but without having to injure myself in the process. Overall, even though it is only in Alpha, this is the most polished sandbox driving simulators I have ever used.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								I refunded this game, but I'd recommend it.  The game is a lot of fun if you like setting up crashes.  The crash/soft body physics are a thing of beauty.  You can spend many hours messing around with crashes.The game gives you a lot of tools and tweaks, almost too many for the average user.  You don't have to use all the tweaks but it's nice they are there for power users.Why did I refund?  Well, I was hoping for a slightly more arcade like driving experience.  The game is a great crash simulator, but I think it falls a bit short on having fun racing/driving physics.  It does crashes better than any other game, but it's not really a racing game.  Next Car Game or even Crossout is a bit more focused on racing/driving.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								Let me tell you a story.When I was very young the darker side of my mind was very interested in cars crashing into each other. I thought it was so cool to see to cars slamming into each other and fly across the road. I was 5.During that phase I kept looking for a video game that would let me do that. All I found were animations, or unrealistic games.Later on, about a year ago, I saw GMOD on sale and decided to buy it, thinking it would suit my needs. I didn't.I was so dissapointed. Would I ever find what I was looking for?A few months later, I saw BeamNg through the corner of my eye on youtube and went to check it out.I thought it was beautiful. Within a few weeks of that moment I had owned the game.So, in conclusion, thank you BeamNg.Drive. You have fufilled my crazy childhood dreams(even though I am still a kid) by making an awesome game which is hours of fun.Now, on to the good stuff!PROS:Everything aboveSuper Realisticfully ModableCONS:You NEED a TURBO POWERFUL computer(I mean it when I say that) to run this game. I had to buy a $100 GTX 750 Graphics card to increase the preformance from 5-15 to 40-55 FPS. It STILL runs a little slow.Overall, this is the ultimate car game. Get it. GET IT NOW.10.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have had this game since before it came onto steam,  back then the developement was pretty slow with only one a team of around 8,  since, the team has grown heaps, the developement of vehcles has picked up hugely, Along with the official content there is plenty of mods, though I can't say most modding of this game is easy due to the complexity of its soft body physics engine, when you get your head around it, its fun to♥♥♥♥♥♥about with the cares like put really wind wheels on a impressa equivelent vehicle, add a huge wing and give it an rediculiously powered motor.But by far the best is the soft body physics which comtines to improve, the satisfying ability to know  that the stunt you just did was probably bloody accurate, and when you just feel like wrecking cars or watching your car crumple when u drive far to fast.This game has capiblities far beyond cars, it'll be interesting what the future holds for a physics engine like this.only problem for most people as there is little to no campain, with only a few vanila senarios, which are check point races, this will be built on later but its sill early in developement.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2
Early Access Review
								NOTE: This is going to be my first review EVER.This game is just so amazing, it's one of it's kind, no racing simulator is the same or probably will be in many years. The amount of work that the developers have putten into this game is just mental, and i just can't imagine that how much they've done optimizing work to get it to run on todays hardware properly. It even runs on my I3, which is a very big surprise at least for me. But the game does have a few problems, for example the bugs and glitches. The game is usually pretty stable, but sometimes the game will just bug out for no real reason, this usually happens if you crash your car too violently (at least for me). And of course you need to setup all the settings and controls before you can actually play, it's a sim after all. Pros: -Physics-Variety of cars and maps-Customization of cars (Parts, tuning)-A lot of things to do, for example scenarios and campaigns-Graphics look good, even on the lowest settings possible-A HUGE mod community on their own website (http://www.beamng.com/resources/)-No DLC, the devs keep updating the game for free-The price is pretty affordableCons:-Can be unstable sometimes (Crashes, bugs etc.)-You'll need a pretty good pc to run this game properly, at least with many cars-New updates almost always ruin mods-Props should be easier to place-You'll need to setup this game and it takes time if you're playing with a gamepad (especially the PS4 gamepad) or wheel-No PS4 controller supportTL;DR: Get this game, if you like crashing cars but don't want to do it in real life.

content:

Early Access Review
								I crashed my car into a bridge.And a tree.And everything else.Be honest, this game should be called BeamNG.Crash.---First thing, the new campaign is pretty good. It is mostly crashing, but it uses some new automatic clever camera angles and slo-mo timing for you to experience the game like never before. All you have to do is .driveThe scenarios are good. I love the chase ones, because who doesn't like a car chase? There are plenty more modded scenarios once you go through the default though!Mods are great, pretty simple way to add them even though not steam workshop. You can also manually copy files into the mod area so check the actual forums as well as the mod repository.It even works with my steering whell, Logitech G29. Haven't tried it with the shifter though, but it was interesting considering I've never driven!Only issues are the occasional problem with an (outdated) mod, having to renable fullscreen when tabbing out, and no explosions ;)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's not a complete game yet, but I recommend it.  The game has evolved since I bought into it's Early Access; so it is not abandonware.The soft-body damage sim system is bloody fantastic and deep.  Not completely realistic, but fantastic.  I'm sure you've seen YouTube videos of BeamNG.drive crashe motages and cars tumbling down mountains getting all smashed up.  The only thing missing is the ability for cars to explode.  They never do.  All they do is sometimes catch fire if you rupture the fuel tank.While this is not yet finished, there is a very large selection of activities (scenarios) you can do.  Checkpoint races, jumping, stunts, destruction missions and other ways to take advantage of the game's unique and extensive soft-body vehicle engine.  There is plenty to do here; it's just not a complete game yet.  The game is also highly moddable so you can create your own scenarios and even 3D props and tracks if you know your way around a 3D modeling program.The game's configuration and control options are DEEP.  It works spectacularly with the Steam Controller once you can figure out how to configure it all.  Steering with the track pad feels great.  The only thing better would be a real steering wheel controller.  Some day!The game's graphics are not state of the art, but they are very crisp.  Let's say crisp but a bit dry.  It would benefit from some ambient occlusion, physically based rendering or other cutting-edge graphic engine elements.  If the game had the graphics engine of Rocket League or Mad Max it would be a very impressive thing indeed.  But what is here is very servicable.  The frame rate is silky smooth on my GTX960.  On the other hand the amount of trees and other foliage around the road is impressive.Now for the negatives.  The game has a beginnings of a campaign.  Appropriately named "Rocky Start."  The actual gameplay is fun.  It has the beginnings of an open-world map with activities you can choose with rewards.  Great stuff.  But the presentation...  It is disjointed.  They chose to use cartoonish, 2D flash-type animations to lead into each part of the campaign.  The art is flatly drawn cartoons.  The people...  I'm sorry.  They look like they tapped someone from DeviantArt.  Crudely drawn cartoons.  The animation looks very low-budget.  This directly contrasts with the actual game world where everything is dimensional, lush, detailed and obviously lovingly crafted.  The 2D art really brings the game down a peg.  And there is other 2D art within another part of the game that is far superior.  They should sack the new artist and use the first one.  Yeah it had the limitations of being 2D but it has style and looks much more professional..  Ugh.. Sorry.. as an artist it's just a pet peeve of mine.  If you aren't going to do it right, don't do it at all.Pros:+ Soft-body physics engine produces AMAZING crashes!+ Skill-based driving and racing.  Watch out for that rock on the side of the narrow road.  It will end your car!+ Variety of activities with a large range of difficulties to choose from+ Nicely crafted (fictional) car models+ Pretty well detailed environments to drive or race through+ Awesome stunts & jumps+ Deep control configurability / Great with Steam Controller+ Free-roaming and wrecking is relaxing fun+ It does not seem like it will become abandonware so farCons:- It's not finished yet (as expected for Early Access).- Graphics engine does not look as good as it could (yet?)- No explosions (yet?)- Ugly, low-budget animated intro segments that are thankfully skippable.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								Very fun game. VERY realistic soft body physics, and overall vehicle mechanics entirely; Even down to handling, braking, etc. Each part of the car is clearly modeled as well. Lots of fun crashing cars for hours. Good mod support as well for extra cars, scenarios, terrains, etc.There isnt much to do outside of just aimlessly crashing cars, but there are scenarios for racing and such. There might be more to supplement the game later, since the developers are very active on updating the game. (Thank god for active devs!)Oh. You're going to need a fairly strong computer to play this game if you want 60+ FPS.

content:
Posted: October 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is absolutely incredible. The physics, the cars, the gameplay, the visuals, everything. I've always loved this game, and I've wanted to play it for so long. I got this game about 4 months ago, in fact, I only made a Steam account so I could play this game as soon as I possibly could. Of course, there are some that dont like cars as much as others, but those people would still enjoy this game, I'd imagine, as watching stunts preformed or things getting blown up would catch their eyes instead of the highly in-depth car customization. This game is definately my favorite on Steam, even if its Early Access, the whole concept in astonishing, and if this is just the start of this game, then holy cow, us BeamNG.drive fans are in for a treat in the future. 5 out of 5 star rating. Would definitely recommend this game to any friend.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								   I purchased this game with a craving for more than just soft-body physics and crash derbies. My ultimate goal was to quench my thirst for drifting, rally racing and free-drive courses for fun.    Surely, I have halted my search for I have found the perfect gem. The name makes the game sound like a total simulator with only purposes for recording data, but I assure you it's so much more and has a plethora of activities to partake in.   I love to imagine that the Sunburst is a WRX and that I'm a daring rally car screeching through the woods. I think I'm going to rack up tons of hours.

content:
Posted: April 10
Early Access Review
								Do you love annihilating things? Do you love annihilating things in slow-motion? Do you enjoy slamming cars into walls? Well then this is the right game for you, there's no real point other than just destroy everything, but it's fun to find new ways to decimate cars. It's an oddly satisfying game and works wonders to reduce stress. Graphics are good but just make sure your rig can handle it, the framerate drops a lot in places like the forest, however it's buttery smooth in the less populated areas. My only complaint is that if you've already done everything then the game can start to feel a little repetitive, but that's just the nature of the game. Overall it's worth the money, just a bit of a shame that they only do small 10-20% discounts on it, regardless, it's still a good investment in my optinion. 7/10

content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's not a complete game yet, but I recommend it.  The game has evolved since I bought into it's Early Access; so it is not abandonware.The soft-body damage sim system is bloody fantastic and deep.  Not completely realistic, but fantastic.  I'm sure you've seen YouTube videos of BeamNG.drive crashe motages and cars tumbling down mountains getting all smashed up.  The only thing missing is the ability for cars to explode.  They never do.  All they do is sometimes catch fire if you rupture the fuel tank.While this is not yet finished, there is a very large selection of activities (scenarios) you can do.  Checkpoint races, jumping, stunts, destruction missions and other ways to take advantage of the game's unique and extensive soft-body vehicle engine.  There is plenty to do here; it's just not a complete game yet.  The game is also highly moddable so you can create your own scenarios and even 3D props and tracks if you know your way around a 3D modeling program.The game's configuration and control options are DEEP.  It works spectacularly with the Steam Controller once you can figure out how to configure it all.  Steering with the track pad feels great.  The only thing better would be a real steering wheel controller.  Some day!The game's graphics are not state of the art, but they are very crisp.  Let's say crisp but a bit dry.  It would benefit from some ambient occlusion, physically based rendering or other cutting-edge graphic engine elements.  If the game had the graphics engine of Rocket League or Mad Max it would be a very impressive thing indeed.  But what is here is very servicable.  The frame rate is silky smooth on my GTX960.  On the other hand the amount of trees and other foliage around the road is impressive.Now for the negatives.  The game has a beginnings of a campaign.  Appropriately named "Rocky Start."  The actual gameplay is fun.  It has the beginnings of an open-world map with activities you can choose with rewards.  Great stuff.  But the presentation...  It is disjointed.  They chose to use cartoonish, 2D flash-type animations to lead into each part of the campaign.  The art is flatly drawn cartoons.  The people...  I'm sorry.  They look like they tapped someone from DeviantArt.  Crudely drawn cartoons.  The animation looks very low-budget.  This directly contrasts with the actual game world where everything is dimensional, lush, detailed and obviously lovingly crafted.  The 2D art really brings the game down a peg.  And there is other 2D art within another part of the game that is far superior.  They should sack the new artist and use the first one.  Yeah it had the limitations of being 2D but it has style and looks much more professional..  Ugh.. Sorry.. as an artist it's just a pet peeve of mine.  If you aren't going to do it right, don't do it at all.Pros:+ Soft-body physics engine produces AMAZING crashes!+ Skill-based driving and racing.  Watch out for that rock on the side of the narrow road.  It will end your car!+ Variety of activities with a large range of difficulties to choose from+ Nicely crafted (fictional) car models+ Pretty well detailed environments to drive or race through+ Awesome stunts & jumps+ Deep control configurability / Great with Steam Controller+ Free-roaming and wrecking is relaxing fun+ It does not seem like it will become abandonware so farCons:- It's not finished yet (as expected for Early Access).- Graphics engine does not look as good as it could (yet?)- No explosions (yet?)- Ugly, low-budget animated intro segments that are thankfully skippable.

content:
Posted: January 2
Early Access Review
								NOTE: This is going to be my first review EVER.This game is just so amazing, it's one of it's kind, no racing simulator is the same or probably will be in many years. The amount of work that the developers have putten into this game is just mental, and i just can't imagine that how much they've done optimizing work to get it to run on todays hardware properly. It even runs on my I3, which is a very big surprise at least for me. But the game does have a few problems, for example the bugs and glitches. The game is usually pretty stable, but sometimes the game will just bug out for no real reason, this usually happens if you crash your car too violently (at least for me). And of course you need to setup all the settings and controls before you can actually play, it's a sim after all. Pros: -Physics-Variety of cars and maps-Customization of cars (Parts, tuning)-A lot of things to do, for example scenarios and campaigns-Graphics look good, even on the lowest settings possible-A HUGE mod community on their own website (http://www.beamng.com/resources/)-No DLC, the devs keep updating the game for free-The price is pretty affordableCons:-Can be unstable sometimes (Crashes, bugs etc.)-You'll need a pretty good pc to run this game properly, at least with many cars-New updates almost always ruin mods-Props should be easier to place-You'll need to setup this game and it takes time if you're playing with a gamepad (especially the PS4 gamepad) or wheel-No PS4 controller supportTL;DR: Get this game, if you like crashing cars but don't want to do it in real life.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								If you like to constantly crash cars into things and recreate police crashes, or having a semi truck mow down a sedan, or even just a head on collision with a wall, this is the game. The game's physics are something to aw to, yes it may get boring at times, but if you become tense from another game, or just need something to consume time, this game can fulfill. If you have ever thought about a car crash that you'd want to see what would happen and see how it plays out then this is the game. I played the game for over 35 hours without mods (mainly because I couldn't figure it out) and I had fun with the game every time. Once I figured out how to use mods, oh boy, the gameplay and replayability doubled. I also love the fact they are updating the game and adding new stuff, the new items progressively getting better. There are a few downfalls though, mainly the game's framerate but that can always be solved by reducing the graphics, I've found that the dynamic reflections basically kill the game's framerate. If you turn that off It will run much smoother, and if not theres many other settings to toy around with. The app feature is also a fun feature, being able to customize the UIs you see while driving, whether it be the car's preformance, to it's damage, to just the ability to make the car fly across the map with wind. I also love how if you make a single mistake while driving, the car will go into a fishtail and either, fly off a cliff or, hit a tree causing the car to now look like a U. The scenerios are fun, but they aren't forced apon you inorder to play the game, which is amazing. this game is the definition of Open World. Everytime I play this i'm finding new ways to crash, crunch and demolish each car, and since they finally readded the AI feature "Chase," Oh man I can't explain how much more fun police chases have become. I've bought this game twice the first being before steam, and the one on steam, not because I didn't know how to transfer my key from the off-steam Beamng.Drive, because I wanted to support the developers of this game. I can't recommend this game enough to all car enthusists, if you love driving cars and crashing them, then buy this game, just buy it and slam a drift tune car into a semi truck or install a mod and attach a car to the front landing gear of a plane and fly, fly like a freebird.

								Let me start off this review by saying I've been following BeamNG since 2012 and bought as soon as the initial release happened in 2013. The dev team has been amazing in supporting and updating the game.Pros:Amazing physics, detailed car design, helpful dev team. The maps are absolutely beautiful also. Cons:The engine is a small bit unoptimized, but the dev team is working on it. Also, sometimes there is a while between updates but the past few have been very timely, and it seems a lot of background work is behind us.All-in-all I recommend this game, though it might not be for everyone. A majority of the game right now is a free-roam crashing simulator, though the devs have added a good many situations and races. Also, this is a state of the art engine. You'll need a fast CPU, and sadly AMD has an architecture stuck in the past. More cores do help, but your AMD will need to be clocked a fair bit higher than usual to keep the FPS other games do. A modern (4+ series) Intel needs about 3.4Ghz to play most of the cars, to keep even the most intensive at 60+fps you'll need 4.0Ghz. Like I said though the engine is being optimized.On the GPU side you can keep solid 60fps on medium with a 280x, and high will keep you mostly 60 but sometimes into the lower 50s. If you max the game with PostFX and reflections it will drag a 280x into the 20fps range and even a 290x has issues keeping up. This hasn't been as much of an issue until this update, so I'll update if it changes again.TL;DR smashy, you need a good computer. I rate 10/10

content:
Posted: April 18
Early Access Review
								Great game 93/100Pros: - Great, if not the best, physics engine. Destruction is very realistic and awesome. - Driving is realistic and fun. - Okay Modding + Easy Modding. - Not many updates but I do see them adding content or general updates every now and then. - Good offroading. - Fun at any framerate.Cons: - No Multiplayer. - I would like to see more vehicles be added to the game through the developers side, modding is okay but not perfect for this game. They did just release a new offroad vehicle that resembles a Jeep so it's good to know that they are workign on adding more vehicles to the game. - No aircraft or boats. This one I don't mind much at all or really care about but I think it would be great if they added planes, helicopters or boats into the game. - Sounds are, well, not the best. Some vehicles it fits while others it just doesn't. Mods do change some of the sounds but I think that the devs should work and fine tune the sounds a bit more. - Framerate can get low when you have a good amount of vehicles spawned in. For example, if I get 5-10 trucks on one map, I would experience a pretty high fps drop. It's not much of a gripe as it is fun at mostly every framerate, at least above 30. - Not a con but a recommendation, devs, please take out "Free to Play" from the game's tags. ;)System The Game Was Tested On:i5 6600k @3.5GHzGTX 1070 No Overclock16GB Deditated Wam240GB SSD

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Okay, after owning and playing this game for the past two years, it's probably time to write a detailed evaluation.I use an Acer Aspire V5 with a crappy A10 CPU and 8650G integrated graphics. I play this game fine sometimes on low graphics, though I am not able to play at full time at all, just due to the specs. You'll get used to the latency and lag. Remember SSAO kills performance, and adjust other settings until desired performance is reachedThe driving feels solid to me. I have had no previous real life driving experience, but this game in my opinion responds better to input than Forza 5, similar to Forza Horizon 3, if you drive properly in this game. Remember to play in a fixed camera view, basically anything but orbit. This is because when the tires start slipping, you can detect and correct the slipping earlier rather than in orbit mode, where the camera is relatively lazy. Remember also specific reactions to drivetypes, like accelerating when an fwd car is in an oversteering state.Remember to use DELICATE TRIGGER CONTROL. The steering is 1:1 with your trigger AT ALL TIMES. It's extremely easy to understeer by turning too quickly, and to overcorrect after initiating oversteer. Also, the skidding sounds seem inconsistient with what's happening, and it's loud basically all the time, which causes you to overreact. Try to trust the visuals more than the sound in this game at it's current state.Once you get used to the controls, it's very satisfying. Just remember to be patient, as the controls require caution and delicate control for maximum enjoyment.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								When I bought this game in December 2015 it was really just a car crash sandbox and it was great then. Over the year there have been many updates that are bringing this closer and closer to actually being a proper game. It's the only thing I've bought Early Access and don't regret it at all, have more hours played in this than many other full games I paid full price for in the same genre. It does need a pretty good PC to run, my specs are i7-4790, GTX 960GT with 2GB VRAM, 12GB RAM and although it mostly runs at 60fps it does stutter from time to time and having more than 3-4 cars on the map at the same time really slows it down noticably. It's not a dealbreaker at all but I doubt it would run well on older/lesser systems. If you're on the fence about this one, pick it up!

Yeah, this game has lots of potential, which is transformed into proper gameplay features.Highly recommend for any car simulator lovers.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Beamng.Drive is the most realistic vehicle simulator to date. The crashes are ultra realistic, the damage is ultra realistic, and the physics are ultra realistic. And don't let the graphics card requirements turn you down, because this game really doesn't need that great of a card to run at max graphics settings. I'm running it maxed out at 60+ fps on my Gtx 560 ti 2gb phantom, so no need to buy yourself a Gtx 670 for this game. This game runs great on my pc, but the framerate drops to around 20-40 with 5 cars on screen at the same time, because the game still needs some optimizations. The more cars on screen, the more processor power your pc needs, because each vehicle is extremely highly detailed, and has lots of deformation points and breakables. Ever single vehicle is very advanced and detailed, so you need a very good cpu at the moment if you want to play with 5+ cars on screen. I have an Intel core I5-3470 3.20GHz quad core cpu, and it can handle around 5 cars on screen at once with playable framerates. They said they are gonna improve framerates later on. They want to make 7 cars on screen at once run smoothly on a mid range processor, so the cpu requirements will get lower with the updates. Another awesome thing about this game is all the maps and cars you can download for free. You can also make maps and vehicles and upload them to beamng's website for others to download. It's a lot of fun, and you can do anything vehicle related you've always wanted to do with no limitations! The game's map editor is also very easy to use once you get used to it. You can create cutom objects and buildings for the map editor too by using other programs like sketchup and importing your creations to beamng's editor. It is fairly simple and easy to do. Just watch a tutorial video or two, and you can make maps with ease. Sorry for the long post, I just needed to tell you if you feel the game lacks content, you can create your own content or download content for it that other people created. The game also gets updates, since it's still work in progress, so even if you don't download or make content for the game, you will still have a great time, although I reccomend downloading others's creations and making your own stuff for the game, because it makes the game more fun. This game is very realistic and very fun at the same time. Your car can even run out of fuel, but don't worry about filling up every 2 minutes, because it takes as long as in real life for the cars in this game to run out of fuel. Besides, you'll probably wreck the car before you can get a chance to run out of fuel, since one hard crash can pretty much total your vehicle. This game is a lot of fun, and very realistic at the same time. 10 out of 10. The perfect vehicle simulator.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								OKAY, rewriting review time. This game has matured so much since I've had it. I've played it daily, I've watched it grow, I've poured many hours into this game and interacted with the community. I taught myself many driving techniques with this game (with some mods so stalling a car is actually possible). This game was the exact game i've wanted since I was a little one playing Flatout 2 on my Xbox. Does it have problems? Absolutely. Do these matter? Absolutely not. I can't get enough of this game. The physics are satisfying, and feel real. I've yet to play a game that can make me cringe when I hit something as small as a trash can at low speed like this one can. The cars are unique and beautiful and every one is labored over to give it the exact characteristics of real life equivalents. They're fun, most imporantly, and I can't get enough of whipping the hatchback (Ibishu Covet) around a corner, or abusing the hell out of the Offraod version of the Pickup (Gavril D-Series). Even the level design shows detail, with maps being unique and having a variety of roads and ways to have fun, be it rallying through country in a small Japanese compact, or tearing up the streets in a souped up American Saloon, or ignoring roads and trails in a jacked-up delivery van. Yes, $24.99 may seem risky for an Early Access game, but these devs absolutely show promise. They constantly update the game, they constantly interact with their community, and I've even had conversations with some of the staff... They're great people, and they love this game like it was their child. They prioritize keeping the game updated, fresh with fun and new stuff, and fixing major problems. I can't tell anyone what to do with their money, but I can more than recommend buying this game to anyone who consults me on it. Please do yourself this favor. Quick notes about this game:-ABSOLUTELY USE A CONTROLLER OR WHEEL, keyboard is still fun but is nowhere near as great as the former two options-Fairly demanding, don't expect to have 10-car derbies with a laptop. Even my i7 4790k and GTX 980 only do 9 cars at once on certain levels before it becomes difficult to play-Bear with the devs, there are problems that pop up... With this in mind, do go to the official BeamNG forums for help, the community and devs always find solutions to these problems

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Everyone who likes cars or realistic physics should buy this game/simulator instantly.Positiv:-Many community mods on the BeamNG forum-Very realistic physics engine-Easily modded-Ingame map editor-Awesome developersNegativ:(Bare in mind that this game/simulator is in alpha)-Very few nasty bugs/glitchesNeutral:-The game/simulator is quite low spec PC friendly in terms of it settings.So if you have a low spec PC, I recommend to turn off postFX in the settings.-Need some sort of controller/steering wheel for the best driving experience(I have no problem driving with the keyboard)Conclusion:This game/simulator may be in alpha but it is definitely worth it. It can only get better.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Amazing physics simulation.  Cars feel Real, not like sliding bricks, and deformation/crashing is top notch.  Being in Alpha testing, seeing the amount of updates and improvements to the games engine as well as the graphics and cars/environments themselves really makes me proud to have supported the BeamNG developers mission to create the best, most realistic driving simulator to date from near the beginning.  Big step up from Rigs of Rods both graphically and physically.  Keep it up Devs!! And make sure you support the team, and the community, by visiting the official forum at beamng.com.   Cheers to Steam access!!

content:
Posted: October 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's been almost a year since I wrote my first review for this game, and I feel it deserves an updated review.This is a good game. The crashes are fantastic to watch, and the physics are great. But this game does have a couple problems and improvements that could be made.Pros:-Looks good.-Runs fairly well, but isn't the best at optimization.-Physics are fun.-Crashes are fantastic.-Has a photo mode.-Lots of different scenarios and environments.-Good selection of props and vehicles, it even has a cannon.-Has a practice track.Neutral:-Physics are still a little strange, but has improved a bunch.-Looking/changing your key bindings can be a little confusing.-Menu is still confusing. Cons:-Still has bugs, including the occasional crash.-Controls are still wonky and aren't explained very well.Tl;dr, if you want a crashing/driving simulator, then this is the way to go. But only buy if you have a decently powerful machine and don't mind the strange physics and controls.

Even my i7 4790k and GTX 980 only do 9 cars at once on certain levels before it becomes difficult to play-Bear with the devs, there are problems that pop up... With this in mind, do go to the official BeamNG forums for help, the community and devs always find solutions to these problems

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								BeamNG.drive is a physics simulation from some of the same people that brought you Rigs of Rods[www.rigsofrods.com] and some of its top quality mods. When comparing the two, it is evident that lots of lessons have been learnt and that each developer has improved greatly in their respective field, resulting in state of the art physics that simulate every single part of a vehicle/object with almost true to life accuracy (with accuracy and efficiency being improved as development goes on), near perfectly modelled fictional vehicles that each represent a certain type of vehicle, resulting in a diverse, albeit small selection (current vehicle list, [wiki.beamng.com] in-dev, concept vehicles list[wiki.beamng.com]) , and fantastic locations[wiki.beamng.com] that push the graphics engine, Torque3D[www.garagegames.com] to its limits. Currently, the Small Island map is my personal favourite mainly due to the recent overhaul that added so many little details. I hope Dry Rock is also updated in a similar fashion.In terms of gameplay, it is currently just a sandbox, but a planned update will bring timed races (no advanced AI YET) and online leaderboards to the table as the first step in the direction of given gameplay, but I still think the sandbox will be where the majority of the entertainment is.The game is very moddable, all sorts of vehicles can be added, including helicopters and planes, levels can be created in the in-game level editor, and LUA files that make up quite a lot of the code can be freely edited to tailor your experience to your liking or even add features. A feature that I quite like that has been created by the community with LUA scripting has been changing the engine sound depending on the vehicle that is being used. Mods should only be downloaded from the official forum's showroom and downloading from anywhere else will either leave you with some kind of malware or very disappointed.The current sound system is a placeholder to avoid people moaning about "sound not working" really, with a single engine, skid, and crash sound making up the entirety of the vehicle's vocabulary (can be modded though) and a few ambient background tracks. This will be completely redone eventually.The vehicle's handling characteristics can be quirky at times with some seemingly random veering at very high speeds and vehicles losing friction too easily, but the physics will be continuously improved and tweaked to ensure maximum authenticity. I can see this rivalling high profile racing simulators in the future.The game needs a fairly high end CPU (or more specifically, a CPU with fairly powerful cores) in order to run the physics smoothly. My i5 3570k can run 4 detailed vehicles smoothly, but those with certain AMD CPUs may struggle. Even though they have lots of cores, each core is quite weak. To run the game at max graphical settings, a fairly powerful GPU will also be required, but most semi-recent mid range video cards should be able to run it with lower settings fine. The tech demo will be updated soon so I suggest going to beamng.com and trying it out before purchasing.I've probably sunk hundreds of hours into it so it's safe to say that I've probably got my money's worth.I think that is all I currently have to say, but I'll probably remember something else in 5 minutes.TL;DR:  Physics, mods, don't complain if your ZX Spectrum doesn't run it at 120 fps etc.

content:
Posted: August 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								8/13/2014got my alpha code in email because i had played it a while ago. last time i had played it, it was very similar, but a lot more buggy and had less content. that was probably 1-3 years ago, i cant remember. but i had only played it for an hour and got fed up with it before uninstalling it because it was so ♥♥♥♥♥♥.NOW, it installs over steam, has longish loading times (who cares though), the controls are kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ for m+k but work if you're patient and learn to tap and feather the keys you can deal with it, and the graphics (artstyle) are fairly nice, but a little lacking contrast in the colors.The game runs fairly well, considering how much♥♥♥♥♥♥is actually being drawn on screen and how the devs implemented it (see: placing a bunch of objects on screen by hand). Which means: its really nice to explore and see the sights, but you need a powerful computer to do it. I'm running a 768mb 460gtx and a first gen i7. With all graphics up to high (except the garrys mod-esqe post processing) I get about 15fps while completely stationary in a forrest. with most things on lowest or low (lowest threshold until the game looks like♥♥♥♥♥♥due to flat meshes and NO shading) I can get up to about 55fps.there's a lot of pop-in for random tree areas and buildings, which isnt really a big deal but worth noting.the car handling itself is fairly difficult, because at low speeds the cars handle alright but once you speed up, the fps chugs randomly, the cars feel like they're on ice and makes crashes/flips inevitable. It almost feels like they're trying to make you crash. This is neat for showing off your crash mechanics (which i admit are incredible, i ripped out a part of my steering on one side because i high centered over a large rock and couldnt control that wheel much) you can ctrl+r to reload your vehicle and drop five feet away, but the location drifts a little to one direction each time and you can easily be stuck in a load-loop into a wall or trees or some other obsticle with no way out except to keep hitting reload unti you come out the other side. Pretty annoying, yet..... somehow satisfying when you're free.If I get a wheel or controller, a more powerful computer, and they keep adding content and fixing bugs, I'd say this game could be the driving sandbox (gta style raging/romping) equivalent of a walking-sim type game. There are jumps, trails, roads all around the island in grand touring style, big meadows, swamps, ponds, beaches, abandoned buildings a la ken block, and lots of things to smash your car on and have to reset. It would make a VERY nice exploration/relaxing/personal satisfaction driving sim with a high potential of adventure. My biggest desires for adds/fixes for this game are:1) customizable suspension and drivetrain settings to tweak2) them to keep adding more content because I like the style they're doing it in (the offroad 4x4 stuff is REALLY nice)3) optimizations ZOMG<---4) better color palette (its not bad, just leaves something to be desired and feels washed out when out in the open)6) more cars!!!7) the handling to not be so ♥♥♥♥♥♥ (maybe this is just because im trying to control a sim driving game with a keyboard)8) better follow-view camera9) some extra motivation for playing it besides just screwing around (missions, characters, story, multiplayer, rpg, unlocking more content/vehicles/zones/parts/things, races, timetrials)10) the ability to get out of the car and do other things, gta style)Right now, the game isnt worth much if you dont like driving around irl or in gta games. I dont know much about the pacing of the dev, but Im going to go ahead and say they're slow as ♥♥♥♥. In a few years, maybe this game will be really cool. But, until then, its very much in alpha and has been for a long time. If this is your thing, cool, if you can't entertain yourself by driving around and exploring in a very buggy game, steer clear of this one for now.sound: 6/10 (nice directionality, but all cars sound the same and stuff isnt very dynamic. great ambience. not too buggy.)graphics: 7.5/10 (if you could get it all to run at a decent fps with no pop-in or stuttering, it would be VERY nice.)menus: 5/10 (lots of options, yet somehow still lacking options. average to bad organization. very ♥♥♥♥♥♥ loading times.)art: 7/10 (cool, sterile, matrix like maps. really cool idea of loading up a world feel. surprisingly immersive. "cozy".)playability: 4/10 (sub average. frustrating experience driving around on the roads, but very pleasurable 4x4 experiences.)value: 6/10 (the ability to drop in with no strings is a double edged sword. easy to get into, easy to get out of once it crashes.)overall: 6/10 (its a slightly above average early access game with a lot of potential. whether or not the devs will realize their own potential is a whole different story. I'm going to learn towards "yes, but not in any near time in the future if ever")

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								BeamNG game should definitely be in the steam library of those who love cars as much as they love trashing them. You can spend hours driving 1 of the 11 vehicles available around detailed environments. The game also features AI and supports multiple vehicles to satisfy your deepest demolition needs. UI is highly customizable and easy to read . Recently implemented scenarios are an excellent addition for competitive players. BeamNG also has an excellent forum community and is highly moddable. If you wish to explore, you can choose out of 10 available levels to play in Free Roam. More content is being added into the game roughly around each month (depends on content). With this game you will never get tired of watching the car of your choice crash into a wall at 60 mp/h in slow-motion.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game even though it is unfinished is great even in this state,the detail of destruction is apsolutely amazing and the driving physics are almost perfect.This game simulates the bending of metal on the car in corners,it simulates the bending and folding of tires at sudden acceleration,since the last update it even simulates the turbochargers based on their size and how they would work in real life.The stock vehicles and maps are amazingly made for this game,and the mod support is great too,so if you get bored of the realism of this game you can just download a 6000hp pickup truck and watch it tear itself apart as it is trying to travel in a straight line.This game is not perfect,it is sometimes unstable and it can crash when least expected,also the framerate doesen't depend on your graphical settings it depends on what vehicle you are using and which map you are on,so the game's engine could use some tweaking with that,since it uses only one CPU core per vehicle,no matter if the vehicle is a three wheeled crapmobile or a eight wheeled monster truck it still gets only one core per vehicle,so make sure you check the sistem requirements before buying

content:
Posted: January 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've had this game for a while now and I have been thoroughly impressed with it. Crashing cars in any game is fun but in the case of BeamNG.drive it is outrageously fantastic. The game has an incredible physics engine and beautiful graphic detail which delivers some of the most realistic gameplay I have ever come across in a driving simulator. The variety of vehicles within the game is also very well rounded and with the different mods that can be added on to the game, that variety extends even further. The game isn't without it's flaws which is to be expected with an early access title, but as it is right now, BeamNG.Drive is a great game and is definitely worth a play.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game horrifies me, utterly and terribly. I'm on the last of a fifteen checkpoint trial. I slide around a corner doing twenty-five. My eyes widen in terror when I see a tree clip my back wheel, bending it all to hell and making the race impossible to finish. *presses "R" to restart for the tenth time*Let me just say, this game is hard. Your car will feel slow and clunky and will squash like a bug at seemingly stupid slow speeds. It is just about as realistic in that regard as it gets. Like any racing game, there are fast and slow cars. Except they all break equally as easy, so don't think going faster is always better.And as for so many people saying the cars feel like they're on ice, ignore them. If you've ever driven on solid ice, you would know that you can't get going more than a few miles an hour in a decent turn before you're going sideways. A car is held in place by four little patches of rubber each about the size of your hand. Once you break sliding friction, you're boned.Also, for anyone turned off by the fact that this is a "crashing simulator," I would also disagree. The fun is in the trials. The launching your car off a four story cube in the test world gets boring after a while. There are something like 15 ish trials right now that range from small circuits to long rallies to silly stuff like seeing if you can jump four ramps in a row or make your way down a six-hundred foot cliff. There will be a campaign mode integrated eventually.The game encourages smart driving (knowing the limits of your car, how fast you need to enter turns, when to accelerate and when to brake). You don't need a steering wheel or pedals, but I'm sure they'd be fun.The only issue I have with the game is its checkpoint system. First of all, they're huge and kinda ugly. Secondly, if you try to switch out your vehicle with another mid-race, it screws everything up.I don't mind this one, but the sound is kinda awful. Engines sounds are cool, crashes are just okay, but the tire squeeling is horrible.This game is fun for what it is already, and definitely worth the money. The devs do decent sized updates about every month now and release bug fixes several times a month to deal with whatever they broke in the patches and/or fix other small issues.I never write reviews, but I figured this would be the one. Just goes to show how great I think this game is.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you buy this don't expect much. As with most early access. Or you will be disappointed.I can't say yea get this game. But if you want a crash simulator then maybe.The driving physics are just terrible. It does map to a wheel now. So at least it has that now. It works with an xbox 360 controller fairly well.If you total your car you may have to restart the game, because it just spawns the other car right next to it. If there are trees or other cars you will spawn inside them.The game is not very  playable as it is. Its ok for about 10 minutes or so at a time, but after that it crashes, or you will just get bored. I am not sure the developers mission. The progress has been really slow since I got the game. I expect in the end for the game to be playable, and hopefully at the sim level for driving experience. As for what kind of sim it will be, I am guessing a crash sim involving all terrain situations.

content:
Posted: September 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								I recommend this game to anyone who is in search of a crash simulator, a driving simulator, a game with realistic In-Depth car customisation or just a way to pass some time if you dont want to bother loading into any other game.So far I have played almost 80 hours of this game, which is a fairly high amount for me and actually more than I have played GTA V. I have installed quite a few mods and lokked deep into the vehicle customization.Just a few things you can do in the game:-Simulate crashes with (on my PC) up to six vehicles (which can have a rudimentary AI)-Just drive around and relax-Create your very own dream vehicle from models roughly resembling real life cars-Race around various tracks included in some of the maps-Finetune your suspension in terms of ride height, spring stiffness, track width and more-Install dozens of mods, some of them with incredibly high quality-explore the detailed maps, find all the secret passages- ... and quite a lot more!As far as I can tell, the game runs very smoothly until you spawn to many cars (6 on my PC), it looks great even on lower graphical settings and has a FoV-Slider so TotalBiscuit will be happy. Extremely high velocity/force impacts don't look that great, but are still a accurate depiction of what would happen to a similar car (despite some parts clipping through others bended textures/Jbeams etc...) Aside from that crashes in this game are almost worthy of next generation car testing. E.g. brake thermals and cooling liquids and other stuff gets simulated.Stuff you should know:Though it's possible to play this game with a keyboard you will have a hard time controlling especially the stronger/older car variants. This is because a keyboard limits you to full throttle, none at all and hard braking. The best option would be a steering wheel,but a contoller also works just fine. The game has force feedback compatibility in general, however this doesn't apply to my ancient  SpeedLink wheel.There is a experimental replay feature, but it's still a buggy mess. I guess it will be fixed very soon, look out for that.Which brings me to my next point: The game gets updated regularly (a major content patch comes out every 1/2 months, of high quality, with bugfixes, optimisations and like I said, content). BeamNG also has a very nice and helpful community.What I don't like as of now:-The sounds (which have been described as placeholders by the devs) are plain horrible, but they said that they hired a     sound effects guy in the last devblog.-The particles are not all that detailed and plenty compared to real car crashes-The game tends to bug out sometimes, nothing major, but it's there and its annoying

content:
Posted: December 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								My BeamNG.drive experience:


YouTube™ Video: BeamNG crash compilation 

			Views: 197		

			My BeamNG.drive experience		

Not the best quality but it gives you an idea.BeamNG.drive really is a nice game. I personally adore sandboxes, just because you can do whatever you want. The fact that you can download mods makes it even better, you are actually encouraged to install mods and expand the possibilities to the max. I don't have a drivers license, so I can't say much about how the verhicles handle in comparison with real ones, however, I know enough about physics to say that it is pretty damn good. For example, when you brake slowly without slipping instead of completely burning your tires, you will actually brake faster because the braking force is higher. When you accelerate when your vehicle is flying through the air, you won't see your actual speed because your tires don't touch the ground. Next to all those details you can also place small apps on the screen that show engine info, like the force from the engine itself, the force from the tires, windspeed, weight, G-force, etc. etc. The game does contain some minor bugs, but because it is still an early access game, I don't mind.Overall: 7,5/10

content:
Posted: December 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								"The pinnacle of technology, in a sandbox like game."Beamng drive is modder friendly, which is outstanding, considering it is in an early Alpha state which generally leaves it to be unsupported for modders and the like. The fact that they have an entire website practically dedicated to mods makes the game much more content free and full.The use of scenarios in the game allows users to have an experience that they wouldn’t otherwise have. The constantly expanding game mechanics and car list increments with every update and keeps the game fresh.If you thought the cars were good, you should check out the maps; each map looks stunning and you can tell that each update the developers put months of effort into the map. The ever increasing game mechanics is mind-blowing, from racing around with basic brakes that cause bake fade, to damaging the piston rings and overheating oil.Whether or not you like realistically driving, or like crashing a dragster into a truck, this games has lots of features, and the updates just keep coming.In conclusion, this is probably the best game I have ever come across, rivalling, in my opinion, need for speed most wanted 2005 and burnout 3 takedown. I can't recommend this highly enough.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game can be sumarized in a couple words.HIROSHIMA (He-Row-She-Ma):The United States, with the consent of the United Kingdom as laid down in the Quebec Agreement, dropped nuclear weapons on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki on August 6 and 9, 1945, respectively, during the final stage of World War II. The two bombings, which killed at least 129,000 people, remain the only use of nuclear weapons for warfare in history.In the final year of the war, the Allies prepared for what was anticipated to be a very costly invasion of the Japanese mainland. This was preceded by a U.S. firebombing campaign that destroyed 67 Japanese cities. The war in Europe had concluded when Nazi Germany signed its instrument of surrender on May 8, 1945. The Japanese, facing the same fate, refused to accept the Allies' demands for unconditional surrender and the Pacific War continued. Together with the United Kingdom and China, the United States called for the unconditional surrender of the Japanese armed forces in the Potsdam Declaration on July 26, 1945—the alternative being "prompt and utter destruction". The Japanese response to this ultimatum was to ignore it.On July 16, 1945, the Allied Manhattan Project successfully detonated an atomic bomb in the New Mexico desert and by August had produced atomic weapons based on two alternate designs. The 509th Composite Group of the United States Army Air Forces (USAAF) was equipped with the specialized Silverplate version of the Boeing B-29 Superfortress, that could deliver them from Tinian in the Mariana Islands.On August 6, the U.S. dropped a uranium gun-type atomic bomb (Little Boy) on Hiroshima. American President Harry S. Truman called for Japan's surrender 16 hours later, warning them to "expect a rain of ruin from the air, the like of which has never been seen on this earth." Three days later, on August 9, the U.S. dropped a plutonium implosion-type bomb (Fat Man) on Nagasaki. Within the first two to four months of the bombings, the acute effects of the atomic bombings killed 90,000–146,000 people in Hiroshima and 39,000–80,000 in Nagasaki; roughly half of the deaths in each city occurred on the first day. During the following months, large numbers died from the effect of burns, radiation sickness, and other injuries, compounded by illness and malnutrition. In both cities, most of the dead were civilians, although Hiroshima had a sizable military garrison.On August 15, six days after the bombing of Nagasaki and the Soviet Union's declaration of war, Japan announced its surrender to the Allies. On September 2, it signed the instrument of surrender, effectively ending World War II. The bombings' role in Japan's surrender and their ethical justification are still debated.

Infrastructure needs to be finished in my opinion seriously. To pay bigger attention to other moving objects in a game less static routes.In general this very original and unusual game which I very much hope will be brought to perfectionAs the car simulator from my point of sight - a game is made perfectly! Management in a game is made excellently!Я не буду безумно восторгаться этой игрой,с учётом того что она в раннем доступе она не сильно привносит сногсшибательных эмоций вождения автомобилем.Всецело впринципе это можно видеть и в других играх.Например упор сделан на систему повреждения которая выглядит неплохо, но не на высшем уровне.На мой взгляд можно было бы больше наложить полигонов на машину и тем самым было бы ещё более реалистичная детализация повреждения(если на то уж пошло и  делать упор на повреждения)Графика в игре на хорошем уровне но всё-таки можно было добавить разнообразие ландшафтов и инфраструктуру текущей трассы.Инфраструктуру нужно на мой взгляд  серьёзно доработать.Большее внимание уделить другим движущимся обьектам в игре и меньше статичных трасс.В целом эта очень оригинальная и необычная игра которая я очень надеюсь будет доведена до совершенстваКак симулятор автомобиля с моей точки зрения- игра  сделана великолепно!Управление в игре сделано превосходно!

content:
Posted: November 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game can be sumarized in a couple words.HIROSHIMA (He-Row-She-Ma):The United States, with the consent of the United Kingdom as laid down in the Quebec Agreement, dropped nuclear weapons on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki on August 6 and 9, 1945, respectively, during the final stage of World War II. The two bombings, which killed at least 129,000 people, remain the only use of nuclear weapons for warfare in history.In the final year of the war, the Allies prepared for what was anticipated to be a very costly invasion of the Japanese mainland. This was preceded by a U.S. firebombing campaign that destroyed 67 Japanese cities. The war in Europe had concluded when Nazi Germany signed its instrument of surrender on May 8, 1945. The Japanese, facing the same fate, refused to accept the Allies' demands for unconditional surrender and the Pacific War continued. Together with the United Kingdom and China, the United States called for the unconditional surrender of the Japanese armed forces in the Potsdam Declaration on July 26, 1945—the alternative being "prompt and utter destruction". The Japanese response to this ultimatum was to ignore it.On July 16, 1945, the Allied Manhattan Project successfully detonated an atomic bomb in the New Mexico desert and by August had produced atomic weapons based on two alternate designs. The 509th Composite Group of the United States Army Air Forces (USAAF) was equipped with the specialized Silverplate version of the Boeing B-29 Superfortress, that could deliver them from Tinian in the Mariana Islands.On August 6, the U.S. dropped a uranium gun-type atomic bomb (Little Boy) on Hiroshima. American President Harry S. Truman called for Japan's surrender 16 hours later, warning them to "expect a rain of ruin from the air, the like of which has never been seen on this earth." Three days later, on August 9, the U.S. dropped a plutonium implosion-type bomb (Fat Man) on Nagasaki. Within the first two to four months of the bombings, the acute effects of the atomic bombings killed 90,000–146,000 people in Hiroshima and 39,000–80,000 in Nagasaki; roughly half of the deaths in each city occurred on the first day. During the following months, large numbers died from the effect of burns, radiation sickness, and other injuries, compounded by illness and malnutrition. In both cities, most of the dead were civilians, although Hiroshima had a sizable military garrison.On August 15, six days after the bombing of Nagasaki and the Soviet Union's declaration of war, Japan announced its surrender to the Allies. On September 2, it signed the instrument of surrender, effectively ending World War II. The bombings' role in Japan's surrender and their ethical justification are still debated.

								So much destructive fun!This game features soft body physics. Which means when you crash your car, it bends and smashes realisticly. So are the levelsOverall: 10/10 (Seriously)

Early Access Review
								***Updated review***The developer has fixed a tons of problems with this game and now I can honestly recommend this.This is really fun car physics simulator and this game has the best and most detailed damage modeling what I have ever seen. Also this game have very rich modding community there is lot of vehicles and maps what you can get - and even better now like 98% of that stuff works with the game. And it´s really fun to smash cars. So if you are a creative person and love cars, you can easily spend weeks with this game just messing around. And if you want to photograph cars, you can do it, or if you want smash a taxi with a bus go ahead and try it. There is even aeroplanes modded for this game. Also by editing files you can tune up cars and add engine options etc. But you have to know what are you doing.

Early Access Review
								This game needs a lot of work (the sound is terrible at the moment, sounds like something out of a game from the 80's), but the physics and controller support are amazing!This game is in alpha, so I am sure (hopeful) it will get better, but the promise of a game that is everything it promises is... promising :)I look forward to seeing this game further developed into the next level of racing sim.On a side note: the choice (or lack of choice) to use cars that are close to real, but not brand licensed works very well and unless car makers start giving away rights to their vehicles, I don't car if I am driving something with badges that are not "real" (so long as a "Mustang-like" of some generation is eventually included). Looking forward to seeing a LOT more cars.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								Now I have owned Beam.ng now for about 1 - 2 years and let me tell you from experience, it is incredibly well put together.  I decided to take a gander at the negative reviews, and noticed one common thing about them.  They all have barely over (if not under) one hour spent on the game.  I will now proceed to break them down.One common hatred towards beam.ng is the car handling.  People keep complaining about the difficulty steering and such, but remember when GTAV came out, and how different the driving was in that game?  It took me at least 3 hours to stop hating it and get used to it.  You cant judge how cars handle based on an hour of gameplay.  It alone took me 5 hours to finally master ONE of them.Another complaint was that people hated how fun it looked on YouTube and couldn't seem to replicate the things that they saw online.  Well guess what?  you heard it as a kid, and you're hearing it now.  PRACTICE.  MAKES.  PERFECT.  I seriously don't want to know how many hours youtubers like WhyBeAre have spent on this game, but i can guarentee it's a lot.  I don't know half of the different featurers that this game possesses and I have spent 42 hours playing this game.So if you're a guy who looks for the TL;DR...If you're a whiny little kid who doesn't want to take a Softbox physics simulator seriously and just wants to hop in the game as fast as possible and blow♥♥♥♥♥♥up, then I reccomend Gary's Mod.   Otherwise, have fun absolutey destroying the cars in this incredible game.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has an extremely addictive personality to it allowing you as the player to interact with the physics of each and every vehicle within this game.I well and truely reccomned this game to anyone that's interested in soft body physics of cars.Also this game features an immaculate representation of time passing, allowing the player to unlock what is not seen by us in the event of a vehicle collision or accident because our eyes and brain can only see at 25-26 frames per second (this is why 60fps and above is good) the mechanic of this game lets you slow down time to a maximum of x100 letting you see the whole crash from start to finish with superb deformity of the cars in this stunning simulation of the soft body physics of cars there is a gravity control machanic letting you choose the gravity on a slider or by clicking the presets given which starts at the sun and finishes at pluto going though each and every plannet in our solar system there is also luna gravity too but only featuring The Moon though.All in all this is a fornominal game and simulation and i've already clocked in 13.8 hours into this on steam but off steam its most likely embarrisingly longer because it's such an inriching and infinatly pleasing experience cars being crashed, crumpled and smoshed either by other cars or just by driving them into walls and not having to explain to insurance companies and loosing your possible future offspring's inheritance. anyway this review is definatly not bias and rambley at all and i think you should buy it for 20 quid on steam because its amazing and cool and stuff. lel

content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								Well what can I say, I’ve had this game since early 2013 And it has finally been released on steam. It’s fair to say that this game has taken a while to get this far and it’s still far from finished, to the point were with any other game I'd criticize it, but with a team so small and so much potential I really can’t.This game is truly brilliant with the best damage models/physics engine ever and fairly good graphics. The only problem is that their is currently very basic AI, no missions/races and no system for buying/repairing cars.But at the end of the day, I get to destroy stuff.(if you see this a few years singleplayer races and such will have been added so it will definatly be worth buying)Update 17/10/15 The AI has improved hugely and there are now a variety of missions including car chases and time trials.

								You will not find a game like this anywhere else. You cannot compare this with 'Next Car Game', they are completely different games. 'Next Car Game' sacrifices it's realism for a better racing experience, whereas BeamNG.drive focuses completely on realism. The developers plan on adding a career mode with various gamemodes such as races and delivery missions. At the current time, even without these missions, this is by far my favourite "racing" game.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								Nobody can say should you buy this or not because first of all its a early access still so the game isnt finished yet but hope it will be soon.PROS- Crashing!  Crashing seems really good if you have seen real crashes- Cars. You can choose in Early access many cars not just few like many other sandbox games gives us.- Car Tuning.  In some cars you can tune them a lot! it makes it really interesting :)NEGATIVE- Driving :(   Sadly the driving isnt really good and you lose your grip REALLY easily. driving in a normal road 60km/h and wosh you are in the tree next time..- Scenarios.  Scenarios becomes negative just because the driving.. some Scenarios are really fun and cool but when you get a road what is jumpy as hell.. you just cannot keep your car straight it just keeps going to the tree in no time.- AI.  The bot driver mostly these Scenarios where you are a Police this AI can be smart or just really really stupid.. there isnt much where you versus bot is but I hope there will be more..Yeah this game isnt now or never will be made for Racing or do missions etc but I hope :) its a good start and I believe it will be good in the end.. 7/10 would cry more but tired

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								Awesome! Though the title says that Beam.NG Drive is in Beta testing, it is definately worth the money! As there are many pros to this game, I would like to point out the only con of this whole game. I would DEFINATELY RECCOMEND this game for people who have computers with a 4.0 or over graphics processor on their computers. I have a 4.0 on my graphics processor (I obviously don't play lots of games on my PC), and unfortunately I lag a lot on maps other that the empty, infinite one, and the testing area with the half pipes and stuff. <-- (Sorry, I forgot the names of the maps..) Anyways, for a lot of reasons I would actually definately reccomend this game to people with (fairly good) computers.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								I know what some of you are thinking, "this is basically a tech demo, how can you have fun enough to equal $25?" My answer to you is this; ya just do.Although it is a very bare-bones "game", somehow Beamng manages to pull me back in every once in awhile. I cant even really explain it, but Im not really sure I have to, because from my experience, the physics engine really does live up to the hype. The way the metal twists and bends freely, the way the tires burst if you land hard, the way the reliant robin constantly gets scratches all over because it is the worst thing ever concieved by man...And the thing is the game isnt even close to being a polished product yet, which means there will most likely be so much more added by the time the release is official.In short, get this game, because its freakin awesome.

content:
Posted: March 30
Early Access Review
								I've got real addicted to this game but there is one problem I spotted, if you spawn a car near trees, it may spawn inside of the tree.In the next update, could we get a system that allows you to spawn the car in the place you want?I'm not saying the game's bad or anything, it's good. I got a car to follow another car when that car was fleeing from the car following that car. I know, that makes no sense at all. But the game is great.The main problems I sometimes have are:-I mostly can't switch to another car with the tab button,-I sometimes spawn inside trees (As I mentioned earlier),-And sometimes the circular menu thingy dot cursor thing (End me) keeps aiming at the wrong thing and choosing the wrong thing to what I want doing.Now these problems I want fixed.Overall, the game does have  nice performance and realistic physics which makes me get addicted to this game, all I do is break cars apart.If I was to give it a rating out of ten, it would be 8/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								I LOVE THIS GAME! I PLAY IT IN ALL OF MY FREE TIME ! I have 21 hours on record and 1.6 hours this week and counting. I love the variaty of vehicles and props and most of all obliterating cars! I'm a car geek and I stumbled on to this game and just loved it! I think i've had it for 2 years now. I just started making videos for the game itself, and and of course MODS. The modding community is outrageous and there are plenty of cars and terrains to choose from. If you get bored (I still haven't!) then definately check out BeamNG.com/mods! I would recommend it to anybody with a great PC. The graphics are amazing on my home built PC, but If you have like, an HP or Dell that works to. I haven't tried on the Mac though. I think it has support. Yes, I have three computers and a laptop. ok, now i'm off topic but I would like to say that it is worth 24.99! and last Dear devs, if you could add a minivan to smash, that would be great!

content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								BeamNG.drive: A Sequel To The Beleved Rigs Of Rods.         BeamNG Is Awsome!   It Has Soft Body Physics I Have enever seen any other company in the world do this. There Are Many Different Vehicles In The Game Here Are A Few:       Gaviril Barstow:   D15 Pickup:    Ibushu Covet:     Gavril Grand Marshel:    Hirochi Sunburst:   Ibushu Pessema: And More:      As Well The Game Updates regularly The devs Show Lots Of Good Hard Work. Ive Been Following This Since 2012: It Has come A Very Very Long Way Since: The game Also Features A Part Configuration System. You Can Change Any Part Of Any Vehicle To What You Want.   For Example  I can Make My Car Have No Roof   Have No Doors      No Engine:     Or Even A Frame:       There Is Also Many Different Types Of That Same part such As: Racing Steering Wheel:    Regular Steering Wheel:   Offroad Tires: Or Regular Stock Tires:   Every Single Part Of A Vehicle Is Simulated:  The Gauges On The dash Board:    The Petals Such As The Gas Petal And Brake Also Clutch:   The Shocks/Springs  The Suspension:     The Engine:     The Head And Tail Lights:      And Remember Its All Destructible!
