Posted: July 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								Three Reasons Why You Should By This Game:Amazing physics you wont find anywhere elseScenarios you wont find anywhere elseGo to 1But in all seriousness, this game really is amazing, why buy a brand new Ferrari, when you can download one for free?Why go listen to some dumb old car dealers when you can pick out cars for yourself?Why spend money on a plane ticket when you can do amazing tricks in a stunt plane, with no license!Why pay 100s, or even 1000s of dollars on a new paint job, when you can do one for $0?                                                                                                                                                                                                     This game generates genuine laughs from my whole family, even my dad, who hates video games. Literally, best car game I've ever played.In all this game's awesomeness, I would like to see one thing added. It would be really neat if you could add an NPC option, your enable or disable it, and it would provide NPCs for all the maps. So you could crash, or try to get passed traffic. content:
Posted: March 9
Early Access Review
								This game is one of the best games I've played!! It's so realistic, you can choose from many car models to play as, you can set the AI for other spawned vehicles. I love to use the "Chase Me" AI option, as it makes other spawned vehicles chase you. And I LOVE the car crashes, it looks soo realistic, like what you might see in real life!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10
Early Access Review
								Searching for a game in which you can do virtually anything you can do in a real car and much, much, more?Ever seen one of those accident animations made by road safety insitutes and such, and wished it was a game?Ever wanted what a racing game would be like if your vehicle took damage just a real car?Ever wondered, what would happen if I load a Ferrari in a box truck which is towing a caravan and drop that whole thing off a skyscraper onto a compact car on top of a police cruiser on top of a school bus?If yes, try BeamNG.drive, chances are good that youˋll like what you see.It is easily the most accurate and fun vehicle sandbox you will find. The dynamic physics and deformations are unique, you can run the same vehicle into the same obstacle as often as you want and never produce the exact same accident ever.Also, this game does "Early access" very right, updates just keep coming. With that and a vivid modding community (off Steam as of now though) you are not going to run out of new toys to play with any time soon.The only thing I really miss is a proper replay function, and the slow motion fuction needs a bit of tweaking as it sometimes glitches out when switching between vehicles.

content:
Posted: April 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								Hi Everyone! I promised one of the people at BeamNG I would give an honest review of BeamNG.drive an honest Review so here it goes. As you can see I have put 37.2 hrs to date actually playing the game but what you can't see is the 100 or so hours I have used in resurching diffrent aspects of the game as well and here is what I have found. For those of you that don't mind doing the reasurch involved and have a better then basic understanding of computer modeling and softwear This could be the best game in the world to own but if your like me and just want to do all the things you've seen on videos and have a imagination that keeps you up nights trying new things but can't quite figure out how to make it happen then this can be quite frustraiting at times and your not alone. Little things like picking up a car and placing it into a position all the way up to building new ramps or objects to run into or over can be quite nervracking if you don'tknow or can't figure out the map editor. Many of the YouTube video's show some pretty awsome stunts but even fewer of them will tell you how it's done. I have spen't hours looking for good tutorials but unfortunetly they are few and far between and they are often incomplete or just plain outdated and don't work withe the ever increasing number of updates. Unfortunetly when using the map editor or any other editor (they have a list) if you don't know what you are doing and are unfortunite enough to know how to get rid of it. You may find the same problem the next time you load the very same map So if there is anything I may suggest is you Back up the game the very first time you load it as well as copy all your mods to a outside folder so they can all be added at the same time should you need to reinstall the game. This was a nother lesson I leaned the hard way.    On the brighter side this game isn't finnished not yet and BeamNG.drive is constantly being worked on by a group of dedicated and carring induviduals from diffrent countries around the world and I've been around long enough to know that anything ever built good takes a long time to perfect. There is so many cool parts of this game and if they keep going at it with the dedication they have exhibited thus far I haven't a doubt someday thier are going to be even larger groups of gammers playing BeamNG.drive and withing they had it there game library a lot sooner. Even if your just an old Hightech junkie redneck like me It's still a lot of fun. As for you You Tubers that like to make BeamNG.drive videos when your showing something that might be new to some of us,  It's ok to show how you did it, not everyone knows what you might know so please pass the info along. THX

content:
Posted: October 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								The most advanced-physics game I've ever seen where you can try over 10 pre-made maps, and over 100 cars that you can edit and paint to match your style! Mods are easy to install and can add all sorts of new features, like new cars, maps, or even planes and boats!!! You could call this a simulator, or a highly-destructive game where you fly burning cement trucks off cliffs! Either way, it's really fun and totally worth the money, but I warn you that it does take a computer at least half-desent!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 8
Early Access Review
								I waited to post a review for Beam.NG because for a while, it was more like a tech demo than a game. I still considered it one of the most fun games I'd played, but it was cumbersome for anyone that wanted to just play a game. The early versions could require as much work as play at times, and obviously a project this ambitious had some problems with performance and optimization.Now between the mods and the actual Campaigns and scenarios built in, I feel comfortable recommending it without reservation. There is plenty of content right out of the box, and the game seems to scale for lower-end machines much better every time an update drops. I simply cannot speak highly enough of this game at this point. Once you dip your toes into the released content, I challenge anyone not to beg for more.Luckily, there is an tremendous mod scene. It's not built into Steam (for reasons beyond me, it's discussed on the forums and the official website). https://www.beamng.com/resources/ Do yourself a plethora of favors, there is a giant banner that will walk you through the incredibly simple process of adding mods (At the time of writing, there is no built-in manager. Just download and move to the corrrect folder, the game detects them on start-up). Also, anything tagged Alpha or Beta is official content that is just not finished or released into the full game. I have barely scratched the surface and try to stick to official mods for compatibility reasons.If it runs poorly, wait it out or request a refund :/ I'd recommend a gamepad or wheel for driving but you'll need KB+M for the interface. The latest patch even made it possible to work the UI over Steam Link (360 controller only), as long as I wasn't trying to go to the moon. If it seems too much like work, spend 10m on YouTube and find a decent beginner's guide (the official site also has plenty of great info). I literally cannot think of a complaint about this game, unless it being made so well that it becomes esoteric counts. I don't count it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10
Early Access Review
								Searching for a game in which you can do virtually anything you can do in a real car and much, much, more?Ever seen one of those accident animations made by road safety insitutes and such, and wished it was a game?Ever wanted what a racing game would be like if your vehicle took damage just a real car?Ever wondered, what would happen if I load a Ferrari in a box truck which is towing a caravan and drop that whole thing off a skyscraper onto a compact car on top of a police cruiser on top of a school bus?If yes, try BeamNG.drive, chances are good that youˋll like what you see.It is easily the most accurate and fun vehicle sandbox you will find. The dynamic physics and deformations are unique, you can run the same vehicle into the same obstacle as often as you want and never produce the exact same accident ever.Also, this game does "Early access" very right, updates just keep coming. With that and a vivid modding community (off Steam as of now though) you are not going to run out of new toys to play with any time soon.The only thing I really miss is a proper replay function, and the slow motion fuction needs a bit of tweaking as it sometimes glitches out when switching between vehicles.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								One of the most detailed collision/physics systems of all time. The cars tend to feel a bit floaty, or too lightweight, as once you hit 60+ mp/h its like traction on your tires becomes disabled. This isn't a racing sim. This is a driving sim. Larger, more detailed environments will bring this game to life, as well as other drivers (either real or AI). Cars are quite customizable, and there's a ton of options for you to play with.I also spent almost all of my play time crashing my car or driving off the cliff level in first person view.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								Concept is very good, but developers are not very nice or good. BeamNG is all about crashing, crash physics and visual damage is 99% real-life like. Here is my BeamNG vs Real Life comparison video 


YouTube™ Video: BeamNG.drive vs Real Life - 120 mp/h Crash Test in Slow Motion (Game vs Real) #2 

			Views: 297,798		

			Part #1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1wC3eN7GPlE Part #3: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3VijxfRkQHw Side by Side comparison of BeamNG Game vs Real Car Crashing into a solid wall at 120 mp/h...		

Very accurate, but developers constantly break things and try adding nonsense that nobody cares about. This game is not about driving or racing, if you want a racing game, play Next Car Game Wreckfest or Need for Speed series, BeamNG is all about crash physics. Developers need to add demolition derby option.99% of people who play this game, play it for the damage and crashes.I do recommend this game, but just be warned ... game is buggy and glitchy and developer support is very poor.2 years ago, developers PROMISED to have demoltion derby events out, now 2 years later (almost 3), they have removed the option to have basic demolition derby, very disappointed in this.Don't get me wrong, game is cool and concept is unique, but progress is slow and developers do what they want to do, they do not listen to the community at all.A good game is not a game where developers do what they want, but a game where developers listen to majority of their customers and fulfill their ideas.

content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								Let me start by saying something that would have interested me before buying -- This is not a realistic driving simulation -What do I mean by this? Every part of the car is physically simulated, each part can break off, be bent etc. It's a very complicated and fairly realistic simulation. As such the behaviour of the cars is entirely dependent on this physics simulation being near perfect - but although it is very good, it is far from perfect.Every car massively understeers, even at low speeds I know from experience driving a car every day to and from work would be absolutely nowhere near breaking traction. In the AWD cars they easily oversteer because of the lack of control at the front wheels. I believe this is due to slight instabilities of the physics simulation - I have seen the front wheels spasming under load and as such they do not maintain friction like they would in a real car.So it's a great physics simulation which is a ton of fun. The damage and crashes are great. But it doesn't come close to being a good driving simulation like DiRT Rally.I recommend this game, but not if you are after a realistic driving sim.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								TL;DR Break cars, break trucks, break the physics engine, break logic. Development is alive. Modding scene is alive.Some people aren't happy with the 30$ price tag... I say don't buy the game then... don't buy any game if you aren't willing to shell out 30$ for a game, but you can some how afford the 900$ rig to run it on.====Cons====*Cars handle like they are buttered up*Acceleration acts like you are a lead foot (unless using keyboard controls)*Advanced controls (like slowmotion and free cam) are tucked away behind a *show advanced controls* button in the controls menu====Pros====*The cars can wad up like a ball of paper*There are some pretty cool mods*Seems to run fine on some potatoes (big lag if using multiple cars or big mods)*If the physics engine wigs out and crashes, the game does not crash, it will simply reset the vehicle it was simulating at the time. This is a godsend.*You'll get better used to the "buttery cars" I mentioned above after a few hours of play.*The UI is clunky but becomes easier to understand after just an hour or so of play*The hud is completely customizable with many gadgets you can place, remove, move around, and resize to your hearts content! (You can also select wether they show in the "driver cam")If you were looking for a serious driving experience you won't find it here. This is a sandbox smash 'em up at the moment. They do have a campaign and the likes in the works right now though. So maybe check back later.

content:
Posted: March 3
Early Access Review
								This game is an inbetween buy. (Please read before downvoting)It has very, horrible things, and very, very good things.I know it's in the early access, but it's been that way for like 3 or more years?I'll start with the cons first.-No option to flip your car. You have to manually drag the car and try to flip it over, or pull it out of ditches.-When crashing or resetting, your car can get stuck inside of objects and underneath the ground, so you have to manually drag it from the ground, ripping off chunks of it and then resetting it, it's just extremely clunky.-When just driving and cornering you can bend parts of the vehicle, thereby making the steering tilt one way or popping the tires .etc.-Some of the maps were built by absolute morons. The giant "test" map with all of the ramps and things has a random tree next to the jumps, a huge random wall for no reason, there is no end to the map, basically you drive until the textures run out and then it's just nothing. There is a halfpipe-tube thing that has a bunch of ♥♥♥♥ing blocks in the way, so you can't drive straight, you can only try to avoid them and drive half way up the pipe, getting stuck in them and breaking your vehicle so you have to reset it, drag it out of it, reset it again, and then try to get out.Personally I also think this game is a taaaad bit expensive for what it offers, but I love it anyway.-- This game has a lot of bugs like this, which make it frustrating at times.PROS:Amazingly good physics and crash detail.Very good car details.Great mod support.Very fun for just a sandbox car game.-Have fun with this game!

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								1. buys sexy new car2. wrecks sexy new car3. realize how awful your sexy new car is4. be happy that you wrecked your new sexy car so you can buy a new sexy car5. life completebtw this game rocks you should totally buy it!! :DSerious Review:PHYSICS:Awesome. Spectacular.This game runs on an engine called Torque3D, and based off my time that I've spent enjoying this game, it's really good. The crash physics are awesome. The suspension simulation, the physics, everything, is perfect.CONTROLS:Has decent wheel support. I think the forcefeedback could be improved, but beyond that, it's awesome.The handling of the cars is just right. Perhaps not the best in the world, but it works really well. The cars feel heavy, the steering of cars isn't too arcade-like, it feels just right.GRAPHICS:Pretty. Moving on.MODDING:It's very easy to do. The developers have made a mod section of their website to easily find mods instead of using the forums. I guess it works, but I don't know why they had to put more load on their servers when they could have simply created a steam workshop. Other than that, you'll never need anything more than winrar it seems. All I ever need to do is just drop files into a folder named "mods". It's incredible.It's a fun game to play. Worth the money.

content:
Posted: January 12
Early Access Review
								Developers keep hindering the fun out of the game for the sake of realism, to some extent the realism is a very fun part of BeamNG however now i'm left with a fustrated feeling when i can't disable something because it gets in the way of having fun and that's why i play games.Engine thermals, they're great and i think work pretty well besides vanilla radiators cannot handle the power of some of the vanilla performance parts and there is no option to turn it off so you can mess with a stupid build or just do fun stuff for the sake of doing fun stuff.Brake thermals/efficency, Actually love it because the developers put pads in the game that i've been unable to kill meaning it's never affected my fun, if i wanted to do stupid things i just put in the best pads and i go have fun, if i want to roast some brakes on a hillclimb car then i put basic ones in. awesome system.Powerterrain improvements, This update is awesome and for the most parts i can't find faults (now i've worked some out aka Throttle/clutch assist). High and low range transfer cases combined with locking diffs is epic for some rock crawling (Edited the manual transmission LUA to disable the scripted gear breaking) however once working out how to get my old shifting style back i've found the game just breaks my gears when i shift without the clutch (i use a controller not a wheel/pedal setup) and this happens fairly quickly, neutral dump on some stock tires and two or three times the gear breaks however if stage three turbo 200BX running 14' slicks at 10PSI and sit there dumping the clutch constantly in first the gearbox doesn't care, enough power dumped into the transmission and grip in the tires to pull the car up onto it's back bumper and it's fine, but i can't go from N to 1 without clutch 5 times (while applying throttle) before it breaks.BeamNG is a good game, I'll probably still play it when something new comes out however i'm finding it harder and harder to have fun, i used to sit and play for hours on end and love every moment but now i play it for a few min and get bored. I get it, making it more realistic can be fun and the such but so can turning off all the serious stuff and driving a 1000hp grand marshal to 400klm/h till the tires expload.In a nutshell i can no longer reccomend BeamNG because it's becoming harder to have fun it, atleast for me, everyone is different.Another edit/update.Developers seems to be so stuck in their ways they come across as stuck up and ignorant unable to understand the simple concept of "♥♥♥♥ realism, I want to have some fun." not only that but with my experance in the automotive trade I both have an understanding of how things work and have actually seen/done some of this in real life. for instance shifting without a clutch seems to be sacrilege and inturn (though old mate Nadeox1 did offer a solution) responded to in a smartassy way, refer to screenshot.) Another point to note is the Surprise!No audio for 'gear grinding' is present at the moment.comment by Nadeox1, there was no supprise... it's actually right there in the post where he quoted me, I know this, this just looks idiot and childish from someone who's supposed to be a game developer?.also in previous posts i've complained about the fact that simply shifting from n to 1st without a clutch would break a gear (a gear not a suncro, the gear would be usable but the synchro would be distroyed) however i can dump the clutch with 1000hp and grippy 14' drag slicks on a stock 200bx transmission and there's apparently no problem but oh no when i change from N to 1st without a clutch while idling "gasps" the gears get distoryed.... -Insert crickets for Diamondback's reply "Of course gears do not break with the clutch. Why do you think they would?"Does noone seem to understand what i'm saying?, not even people developing this game and are so focused on "realism" don't seem to understand some of the basic concepts of a manual transmission. ontop of that, several times i've said dumping the clutch would cause transmission dammage but they keep responding with "There's no clutch dammage yet" I'm not talking about dammaging the clutch it's the ♥♥♥♥ing gears breaking that's stupid.http://imgur.com/a/ktZkJ(This review is baised souly on the Vanilla game not encluding mods as I'm reviewing developer content not user created mods)

content:
Posted: March 3
Early Access Review
								Fun game, Great Devs (check chat of this review as proof) although a very steep learning curve and in my opinion frustrating camera controls it will grow on you.Edit; I cant get used to the camera controls, to be honest they're the worst camera controls i've ever had to use. Hopefully they will fix it soon, but with the camera on a grid without being able to pan left or right, zoom in or out while trying to move objects/vehicles makes freeroam worthless. Which is my next big deal, you cannot place vehicles or props. They are fixed, you can only move them forward, backward up and down. No pitch, turn, etc and when moving the vehicle via f11 mode, the terrible camera controls coupled with what youre holding stuck on the forward grid means it takes 30 minutes to move a vehicle 20 feet when it should take 10 seconds. Great game but until they fix the camera controls, and improve/simplify moving objects/vehicles Ill have to put the game down. Wouldn't recommend it if you're wanting to do freeroam. When everything is already set up, the games fun as hell. But atm the "sandbox" part doesn't work. I should not need to stretch two hands over an entire keyboard, then have to use another none existant hand to hold down every button on my mouse and repeat this 30x just to move an object 20 feet.I know the dev said you'd get used to it, but seriously man. The camera controls and how to place objects just doesn't make sense.Camera should be easily manipulated or atleast have remapping or a tick box As for moving objects/Vehicles all it needs is a CLICK AND DRAG option when the game is paused. Q and E to rotate left or right. Or Alt arrow key... Anything... Think of the game Besiege, it should have camera controls like that. Idk I really want to enjoy this game but its unplayable

number of helpful: 97 of 215 people (45%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								EDIT: Apparently as of 11-26-16 some of these things have been fixed, but I don't have the game anymore so I cannot give an honest-re-review until I purchase it again some time. Consider this an archived review... read the comments along with it to get the whole picture.I feel kind of bad giving negative review of this as there has obviously been a ton of work put into it, but after less than 45 minutes of toying with Beam.NG I was already wondering how I was going to get any more enjoyment out of it before it has significantly more content added. I actually asked for suggestions on the forums and people basically told me that it must not be the game for me... as if I wasn't missing anything.First off, the soft body physics are impressive. Some times the way a car looks after being smashed seems a bit off, like its made of clay rather than metal, but I haven't seen such free-form vehicle destruction in any other game.Sadly I think the very physics that make this unique are what bring about the worst negative point I can think of: NO REPLAYS. Apparently, due to the complexity of the physics, its unreasonable (or impossible) to have the game track and record the movement of all of the individual components of the car for playback later. I understand this, but this in itself basically makes a game that is currently based entirely on looking at crashes feel highly disappointing.  If you manage to do something really memorable, you have no way of watching it again from a different angle. The early access nature of the game also means that, in this case, the engine is the main focus, not the gameplay, so its actually very complicated to do basic things to bring about different situations in the game. Adding AI cars is not simple. Vehicles\objects with extra controls aren't explained anywhere in the game, and you'll have to Google them to figure them out.The modding scene is active, but its all based on a forum and is quite difficult to figure out what on earth you should be downloading, what is compatible with the current version, etc. Its an impressive physics engine, and the graphics are good, but currently the lack of content and resulting repetitive nature of things (only one engine sound for all vehicles last time I played it, and no objectives other than a timed lap) along with the lack of a replay system make it a very tough sell for me, and I've been crashing cars in games since "Hard Drivin'" for the Sega Genesis in 1989... which had a replay system. I hear that there is more to enjoy here with mods and custom tracks and such, but at this point it takes way too much time and effort to find things (scouring forums) to do in the game, and the best part (the crash, the whole reason for the physics engine) is over in a split second with no way to re-watch it.If the game leaves early access and the reviews reflect that there is more gameplay to be had, I'll probably buy it again as it has a ton of potential, but for $25 right now I can only recommend it to those with a lot of time and patience for modding and tweaking, who also have high end CPUs and a desire to smash things over and over and over.If a replay system is even remotely possible... even if it means a reduction in physics complexity... I think this game needs it. I honestly think that this will massively hurt the game's future.

number of helpful: 0 of 8 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								The physics it uses for car crashes are phenominal, the soft body engine is incredible. It truly is a huge advancement in game phycics. However, as fun as it is to repeatedly crash your cars in delicious 60 fps slow motion, You find it a bit repetative at times. The amount of cars to test on is limited and mods are painful to get working and there aren't many. (Steam workshop pls). The campaign and missions take an eternity to load and are fairly repetative. One of the biggest problems I have with the game is the in game editor, I can barely move cars around and setting crashes up and AI is incredibly complex. The game is still pretty early into its development so I make this review with hope that improvements come underway. At this stage in its development, i'd say this would be great for a game engine, like Euphoria. Having soft body slow motion crashes in racing games and things like grand theft auto would be great, but if beamng can be made into a truly fun and entertaining game, that would be great. I appreciate all the work you guys have put in and anxiously await the future.
